content.user_title: Guide EU MDR 2017/745 medical device compliance
content.value_statement: Medical device companies struggle with complex EU MDR requirements for technical documentation, clinical evidence, and post-market surveillance. This skill provides expert guidance on classification, conformity assessment routes, UDI implementation, and Notified Body interactions to ensure regulatory compliance.
actual_capabilities: Provide expert guidance on MDR device classification under Annex VIII (Classes I, IIa, IIb, III)
Guide technical documentation preparation meeting Annex II and III requirements
Support clinical evidence strategies including literature review and PMCF planning
Advise on UDI system implementation and EUDAMED registration requirements
Assist with post-market surveillance plan development and PMS reporting
Facilitate Notified Body selection and audit preparation
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or replace formal regulatory counsel
Cannot submit applications to Notified Bodies or authorities
Does not guarantee regulatory approval or certification outcomes

use_cases.title: MDR Gap Analysis

use_cases.description: Determine appropriate MDR classification class and conformity assessment route for medical devices

use_cases.title: Clinical Evidence Strategy

prompt_templates.title: Device Classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Our company is developing a Class II software medical device that analyzes patient data. What classification rules apply under MDR Annex VIII and what conformity assessment route should we follow?

prompt_templates.title: Technical Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me structure technical documentation for a Class IIa implantable device. What sections are required under MDR Annex II and what information must be included?

prompt_templates.title: Clinical Evidence
prompt_templates.prompt: We want to use existing clinical literature to demonstrate safety and performance for our device. What methodology should we follow for a systematic review under MDR?

prompt_templates.title: UDI Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the UDI requirements under MDR Article 27. How do we assign UDI-DI and UDI-PI, and what is the timeline for EUDAMED registration?

output_examples.input: What are the key differences between MDD and MDR for our Class I device?
output: Key MDD to MDR changes for Class I devices:
‚Ä¢ Reclassification: Some Class I devices may now be Class IIa or higher
‚Ä¢ Technical documentation: Now requires full Annex II documentation (previously lighter requirements)
‚Ä¢ Clinical evaluation: Must demonstrate clinical benefit with scientific evidence
‚Ä¢ Unique Device Identification: Mandatory registration in EUDAMED
‚Ä¢ Person responsible: Must appoint PRRC under Article 15
‚Ä¢ Post-market surveillance: Formal PMS plan required per Article 84

output_examples.input: How do we prepare for our Notified Body audit?
output: Documentation: Organize technical files per Annex II, ensure risk management is complete
QMS evidence: Demonstrate design controls, CAPA system, and document control
Personnel: Confirm PRRC appointment and verify training records
Manufacturing: Prepare process descriptions and validation evidence
Clinical: Have clinical evaluation report ready with PMCF plan

best_practices: Start MDR compliance planning early, as Notified Body capacity is limited and timelines can extend beyond 18 months
Maintain separation between technical documentation and quality management system records for clear audit trails
Update clinical evaluation continuously as new evidence emerges, not just for periodic review
anti_patterns: Waiting until the last minute to engage with a Notified Body, risking capacity constraints
Copy-pasting documentation from legacy MDD files without updating for MDR requirements
Assuming Class I self-certification eliminates the need for Notified Body involvement entirely

faq.question: What is the difference between MDR and MDD?
faq.answer: MDR (2017/745) has stricter requirements for clinical evidence, technical documentation, post-market surveillance, and Notified Body involvement compared to MDD (93/42/EEC).

faq.question: How long does MDR certification take?
faq.answer: Timeline varies by device complexity and Notified Body capacity, typically 12-24 months from application to certificate for new submissions.

faq.question: Do Class I devices need Notified Body approval?
faq.answer: Most Class I devices are self-certified, but Class I sterile/hardware/software devices require Notified Body involvement under MDR.

faq.question: What is the EUDAMED database?
faq.answer: EUDAMED is the European Database on Medical Devices where manufacturers register devices, UDI information, certificates, and incident reports.

faq.question: How often must clinical evaluation be updated?
faq.answer: Clinical evaluation must be continuously updated with new PMCF data. Formal updates are required when trends or incidents indicate risks.

faq.question: What is the PRRC requirement?
faq.answer: The Person Responsible for Regulatory Compliance must have regulatory expertise and be documented in quality system records per Article 15.
